00002 # navicom.py

00007 from curie.navicell import *
00008 from .navidata import *

00011 DEBUG_NAVICOM = True

00013 
00014 def getLine(ll, split_char="\t"):
00015     ll = re.sub('\"', '', ll.strip())
00016     ll = re.sub('\tNA', '\tNaN', ll) # Python float can convert "NaN" -> nan but not "NA" -> nan
00017     ll = ll.split(split_char)
00018     for ii in range(len(ll)):
00019         try:
00020             ll[ii] = float(ll[ii])
00021         except:
00022             pass
00023     return(ll)
00024 
00025 class NaviCom():
00026     """
00027     NaviComm class to handle data and display them in a standardized way on NaviCell maps
00028     """
00029 
00030     def __init__(self, map_url='https://navicell.curie.fr/navicell/maps/cellcycle/master/index.php', fname="", modules_dict="", browser_command="firefox %s", display_config=DisplayConfig()):
00031         """
00032         Initialize a Navicell communication object.
00033         Args:
00034             map_url (str): URL of the NaviCell map
00035             fname (str): name of the data file to load
00036             modules_dict (str): name of the module definition file (.gmt) to load
00037             browser_command (str): command to open the browser
00038         """
00039         # Build options for the navicell connexion
00040         options = Options()
00041         options.map_url = map_url
00042         idx = options.map_url.find('/navicell/')
00043         options.proxy_url = options.map_url[0:idx] + '/cgi-bin/nv_proxy.php'
00044         options.browser_command = browser_command # TODO Add user control
00045         self.nv = NaviCell(options)
00046         # Name of the dataset
00047         self.name = "no_name"
00048         # NaviCell export control
00049         self.exported_annotations = False
00050         self.browser_opened = False
00051         self.biotypes = dict()
00052         # Representation of the data
00053         self.display_config = display_config
00054         # Data, indexed by processing then type of data
00055         self.processings = PROCESSINGS
00056         self.data = dict() # All data
00057         self.exported_data = dict() # Whether data have been exported yet
00058         self.data_names = dict() # Name of the exported data
00059         self.associated_data = dict() # Processing and method associated to each name
00060         for processing in self.processings:
00061             self.data[processing] = dict()
00062             self.exported_data[processing] = dict()
00063             self.data_names[processing] = dict()
00064         self.exported_data["uniform"] = False
00065         self.annotations = dict() # Annotations of the samples
00066         self.modules = dict() # Composition of each module
00067         self.associated_modules = dict() # Number of modules each gene belong to
00068         if (fname != ""):
00069             self.loadData(fname)
00070             self.defineModules(modules_dict)
00071         # Remember how many samples and datatables were selected in NaviCell in the heatmap and barplot editors
00072         self.hsid = 0
00073         self.hdid = 0
00074         self.bid = 0
00075 
00076     def listData(self):
00077         print("Data available :")
00078         for processing in self.processings:
00079             for dname in self.data[processing]:
00080                 if (dname.lower() in METHODS_TYPE):
00081                     print("\t" + processing + " " + dname + ": " + METHODS_TYPE[dname.lower()] + " (biotype: " + TYPES_BIOTYPE[METHODS_TYPE[dname.lower()]] + ")")
00082                 else:
00083                     print("\t" + processing + " " + dname)
00084 
00085     def listAnnotations(self):
00086         print("Annotations available (values) :")
00087         for annot in self.annotations.annotations:
00088             print("\t" + annot + " : " + str(set(self.annotations[annot])))
00089 
00090     def __repr__(self):
00091         rpr = "NaviCom object with " + str(len(self.data)) + " types of data:\n"
00092         for method in self.data:
00093             rpr += method + ": " + self.data[method] + "\n"
00094         rpr += "and " + str(len(self.moduleAverage)) + " modules average:\n"
00095         for method in self.moduleAverage:
00096             rpr += method + ": " + self.moduleAverage[method] + "\n"
00097         return(repr)
00098     
00099     def nameData(self, method, processing="raw", name=""):
00100         if (name == ""):
00101             name = method + "_" + processing
00102         self.data_names[processing][method] = name
00103         self.associated_data[name] = (processing, method)
00104         return (name)
00105 
00106     def getDataName(self, data_name):
00107         dTuple = self.getDataTuple(data_name)
00108         return(self.data_names[dTuple[0]][dTuple[1]])
00109 
00110     def getDataTuple(self, data_name):
00111         """
00112         Return tuple corresponding to the data name or tuple
00113         """
00114         if (isinstance(data_name, str)):
00115             if (data_name in self.associated_data):
00116                 return(self.associated_data[data_name])
00117             elif (data_name + "_raw" in self.associated_data):
00118                 return(self.associated_data[data_name + "_raw"])
00119         elif (isinstance(data_name, tuple) and len(data_name) == 2):
00120             if (data_name[0] in self.processings):
00121                 return(data_name)
00122             elif (data_name[1] in self.processings):
00123                 return((data_name[1],data_name[0]))
00124         raise ValueError("Invalid name or tuple for data: " + str(data_name))
00125 
00126     def getData(self, data_name):
00127         """
00128         Return the NaviData entity corresponding to the data name or tuple
00129         """
00130         dTuple = self.getDataTuple(data_name)
00131         return(self.data[dTuple[0]][dTuple[1]])
00132 
00133     # Load new data
00134     def loadData(self, fname="data/Ovarian_Serous_Cystadenocarcinoma_TCGA_Nature_2011.txt", keep_mutations_nan=False):
00135         """
00136         Load data from a .txt or .ncc file containing several datas, or from a .tsv, .ncd or .nca file containing data from one method.
00137 
00138         Args:
00139             fname (str): name of the file from which the data should be loaded
00140             keep_mutations_nan(str): whether nan in mutations data should be considered as no mutation (False) or missing value (True)
00141         """
00142         with open(fname) as file_conn:
00143             ff = file_conn.readlines()
00144             ll = 0
00145         # Name the dataset according to the filename, and issue a warning if the name changes
00146         dname = parseFilename(fname)[0]
00147         if (dname != self.name and self.name != "no_name"):
00148             warn("Name of the dataset " + self.name + " has been changed to " + dname)
00149         self.name = dname
00150 
00151         dataRegex = "^M |^GENE"
00152         annotRegex = "^ANNOTATIONS|^NAME"
00153         completeRegex = dataRegex + "|" + annotRegex
00154         methodFromFile = False
00155         while (ll < len(ff)):
00156             if (re.search(dataRegex, ff[ll])):
00157                 # Import data
00158                 # Use the method and processing names if they are provided, otherwise deduce them from the filename 
00159                 if (re.search("^M ", ff[ll])):
00160                     line = re.sub("^M", "", ff[ll].strip()).split("\t")
00161                     method = line[0].strip()
00162                     if (len(line) > 1 and line[1] in self.processings):
00163                         processing = line[1].strip()
00164                     else:
00165                         processing = "raw"
00166                     samples = getLine(ff[ll+1])
00167                     if (samples[0] == "GENE"):
00168                         samples = samples[1:]
00169                     ll += 2
00170                 elif (re.search("^GENE", ff[ll])):
00171                     fname = os.path.split(fname)[1]
00172                     dname, processing, method = parseFilename(fname)
00173                     # Deduction cannot be performed
00174                     if (methodFromFile):
00175                         raise ValueError("A type of data must be provided when importing several data in one file")
00176                     else:
00177                         methodFromFile = True
00178                     samples = getLine(ff[ll])[1:]
00179                     ll += 1
00180                 print("Importing " + method + " data")
00181                 profile_data = dict()
00182                 profile_data["samples"] = oDict()
00183                 profile_data["genes"] = dict()
00184                 profile_data["data"] = list()
00185                 ii = 0
00186                 for el in samples:
00187                     profile_data["samples"][el] = ii
00188                     ii += 1
00189 
00190                 gid = 0
00191                 while(ll < len(ff) and not re.search(completeRegex, ff[ll])):
00192                     dl = getLine(ff[ll])
00193                     profile_data["data"].append(dl[1:]) # Data in a list at index gene_name
00194                     profile_data["genes"][dl[0]] = gid
00195                     gid += 1
00196 
00197                     ll += 1
00198                 if (processing in self.data and method in self.data[processing]):
00199                     warn("Overwriting data for method " + method + " with processing " + processing)
00200                 self.data[processing][method] = NaviData(profile_data["data"], profile_data["genes"], profile_data["samples"], processing, method)
00201                 self.exported_data[processing][method] = False
00202                 self.quantifyMutations(method)
00203                 self.nameData(method, processing)
00204                 if (not "uniform" in self.data):
00205                     self.defineUniformData(profile_data["samples"], profile_data["genes"])
00206             elif (re.search(annotRegex, ff[ll])):
00207                 # Import annotations
00208                 print("Importing Annotations")
00209                 if (re.search("^ANNOTATIONS", ff[ll])):
00210                     annotations_names = getLine(ff[ll+1])
00211                     if (annotations_names[0] == "NAME"):
00212                         annotations_names = annotations_names[1:]
00213                     ll += 2
00214                 elif (re.search("^NAME", ff[ll])):
00215                     annotations_names = getLine(ff[ll][1:])
00216                     ll += 1
00217                 annot = dict()
00218                 annot["names"] = list()
00219                 annot["samples"] = list()
00220                 annot["annot"] = list()
00221                 not_all = not "all" in annotations_names
00222                 if (not_all):
00223                     annot["names"].append("all")
00224                     annot["annot"].append([1 for ii in range(nb_samples)])
00225                 for name in annotations_names:
00226                     annot["names"].append(name)
00227                 while(ll < len(ff) and not re.search(completeRegex, ff[ll])):
00228                     al = getLine(ff[ll])
00229                     # Gather each annotation for this sample and add all as the first column if necessary
00230                     if (not_all):
00231                         annot["annot"].append([1] + al[1:])
00232                     else:
00233                         annot["annot"].append(al[1:])
00234                     annot["samples"].append(al[0])
00235 
00236                     ll = ll+1
00237                 self.annotations = NaviAnnotations(annot["annot"], annot["samples"], annot["names"], dType="annotations")
00238             else:
00239                 raise ValueError("Incorrect format, file must be a valid file for NaviCell or an aggregation of such files with headers to indicate the type of data")
00240 
00241     def bindNaviData(self, navidata, method, processing):
00242         """
00243         Bind NaviData to the NaviCom object in order to use it 
00244         """
00245         assert isinstance(navidata, NaviData), "navidata is not a NaviData object"
00246         self.newProcessedData(processing, method, navidata)
00247 
00248     def defineUniformData(self, samples, genes):
00249         self.data["uniform"] = NaviData( np.array([[1] * len(samples) for nn in genes]), genes, samples )
00250         # TODO change to 1.0 when < is changed to <= for continuous data
00251 
00252     def newProcessedData(self, processing, method, data):
00253         """
00254         Update adequate arrays when processed data are generated
00255         """
00256         assert processing in self.processings, "Processing " + processing + " is not handled"
00257         self.data[processing][method] = data
00258         self.exported_data[processing][method] = False
00259         self.nameData(method, processing)
00260 
00261     # Process data
00262     def quantifyMutations(self, method, keep_nan=False):
00263         """
00264         Transform the qualitative mutation datas into a quantitative one, where 1 means a mutation and 0 no mutation.
00265         Args:
00266             keep_nan : Should nan values be converted to O (no mutations) or kept as missing data
00267         """
00268         if (method in self.data["raw"] and METHODS_TYPE[method.lower()] == "mutations"):
00269             mutations = NaviData(np.zeros(self.data["raw"][method].data.shape), self.data["raw"][method].rows_names, self.data["raw"][method].columns_names, method)
00270             for rr in range(len(self.data["raw"][method].rows_names)):
00271                 for cc in range(len(self.data["raw"][method].columns_names)):
00272                     value = self.data["raw"][method][rr][cc]
00273                     if ( re.match("nan|na", value.lower()) ):
00274                         if (keep_nan):
00275                             mutations.data[rr][cc] = np.nan
00276                         else:
00277                             mutations.data[rr][cc] = 0
00278                     elif ( value == "" ):
00279                         mutations.data[rr][cc] = 0
00280                     else:
00281                         mutations.data[rr][cc] = 1
00282             self.newProcessedData("mutationQuantification", method, mutations)
00283 
00284     def defineModules(self, modules_dict=""):
00285         """
00286         Defines the modules to use and which module each gene belongs to.
00287 
00288         Args:
00289             modules_dict : Either a dict indexed by module name or a file name with the description of each module (.gmt file: tab delimited, first column module name, second column description, then list of entities in the module)
00290         """
00291         # Gather the composition of each module
00292         self.modules = dict()
00293         if (isinstance(modules_dict, dict)):
00294             self.modules = modules_dict 
00295         elif (isinstance(modules_dict, str)):
00296             if (modules_dict != ""):
00297                 with open(modules_dict) as ff:
00298                     for line in ff.readlines():
00299                         ll = line.strip().split("\t")
00300                         module_name = ll[0]
00301                         self.modules[module_name] = ll[2:]
00302 
00303         # TODO add control that the genes in the modules have data
00304         """
00305         # Only keep genes with data
00306         for module in self.modules:
00307             keep = list()
00308             for gene in self.modules[module]:
00309                 if (not gene in self.genes_list):
00310                     self.modules[module].remove(gene)
00311         """
00312         # Count the number of modules each gene belong to
00313         self.associated_modules = dict()
00314         for module_name in self.modules.keys():
00315             for gene in self.modules[module_name]:
00316                 try:
00317                     self.associated_modules[gene].append(module_name)
00318                 except KeyError:
00319                     self.associated_modules[gene] = [module_name]
00320 
00321     def averageModule(self, method):
00322         """
00323         Perform module averaging for every modules for one data type
00324         """
00325         assert method in self.data["raw"], "This type of data is not present"
00326         assert len(self.modules)>0, "No module have been defined"
00327 
00328         # Calculate average expression for each module
00329         data = self.data["raw"][method]
00330         samples = list(data.samples.keys())
00331         module_expression = dict()
00332         for module in self.modules:
00333             module_expression[module] = [0 for sample in samples]
00334             non_nan = np.array([0 for sample in samples])
00335             no_data = list()
00336             for gene in self.modules[module]:
00337                 try:
00338                     not_nan = np.array([int(not np.isnan(dd)) for dd in data[gene].data])
00339                     non_nan += not_nan
00340                     non_nan_data = data[gene].data * not_nan
00341                     non_nan_data[np.isnan(non_nan_data)] = 0
00342                     module_expression[module] += non_nan_data
00343                 except IndexError:
00344                     no_data += [gene]
00345             for gene in no_data:
00346                 #self.modules[module].remove(gene)
00347                 if (VERBOSE_NAVICOM):
00348                     print(gene + " from module " + module + " has no " + method + " data")
00349             module_expression[module] /= non_nan
00350 
00351         # Calculate average module expression for each gene
00352         gene_module_average = list()
00353         for gene in data.genes:
00354             if gene in self.associated_modules:
00355                 gene_module_average.append(np.array([0. for sample in data.samples]))
00356                 for module in self.associated_modules[gene]:
00357                     gene_module_average[-1] += module_expression[module] / len(self.associated_modules[gene])
00358             else:
00359                 gene_module_average.append(np.array(list(data[gene])))
00360                 print(gene)
00361 
00362         # Put the averaging in a NaviData structure
00363         #self.data["moduleAverage"][method] = NaviData(list(module_expression.values()), list(self.modules.keys()), samples) # Usefull if NaviCell allow modules values one day
00364         self.newProcessedData("moduleAverage", method, NaviData(gene_module_average, list(data.genes), samples))

00372     # Export data and annotations
00373     def exportData(self, method, processing="raw", name=""):
00374         """
00375         Export data to NaviCell, can be processed data
00376 
00377         Args:
00378             method (str) : name of the method to export
00379             processing (str) : "" to export raw data, processing method to export processed data. See 'averageModule' and 'pcaComponent'
00380         """
00381         self.checkBrowser() # TODO Perform processing if necessary
00382         done_export = False
00383 
00384         if (processing in self.processings):
00385             if (method in self.data[processing]):
00386                 if(method.lower() in METHODS_TYPE):
00387                     if (not self.exported_data[processing][method]):
00388                         name = self.nameData(method, processing, name)
00389                         print("Exporting " + name + " to NaviCell...")
00390                         # Processing change the type of data, like discrete data into continuous, or anything to color data
00391                         biotype = getBiotype(method, processing)
00392                         self.nv.importDatatables(self.data[processing][method].makeData(self.nv.getHugoList()), name, biotype)
00393                         self.configureDisplay(method, processing)
00394                         self.exported_data[processing][method] = True
00395                         done_export = True
00396                 elif (method in self.data['distribution']):
00397                     pass # Avoid bug
00398                 else:
00399                     raise ValueError("Biotype of '" + method + "' is unknown")
00400             elif (method == "uniform"): # Uniform data for glyphs
00401                 if (not self.exported_data["uniform"]):
00402                     self.nv.importDatatables(self.data["uniform"].makeData(self.nv.getHugoList()), "uniform", "Discrete Copy number data") # Continuous is better for grouping but posses problems with glyphs
00403                     name = "uniform"
00404                     print("Exporting " + name + " to NaviCell...")
00405                     done_export = True
00406                     self.exported_data["uniform"] = True
00407             elif (method in self.data["distribution"]):
00408                 pass # Exported on creation, to change for multiple NaviCell
00409             else:
00410                 raise KeyError("Method '" + method + "' with processing '" + processing + "' does not exist")
00411         else:
00412             raise KeyError("Processing '" + processing + "' does not exist")
00413 
00414         # Uniform data have been defined when other datas have, but do not recquire explicit export
00415         if (not self.exported_data["uniform"]):
00416             self.exportData("uniform")
00417 
00418     def checkBrowser(self):
00419         """
00420         Check if the browser is opened or open it
00421         """
00422         if (not self.browser_opened):
00423             print("Launching browser...")
00424             self.nv.launchBrowser()
00425             self.browser_opened = True
00426         return(self.browser_opened)
00427 
00428     def exportAnnotations(self):
00429         """
00430         Export samples annotations to NaviCell
00431         """
00432         self.checkBrowser()
00433 
00434         if (not self.exported_annotations):
00435             self.nv.sampleAnnotationImport(self.annotations.makeData())
00436             self.exported_annotations = True

00438     def configureDisplay(self, method, processing="raw"):
00439         """
00440         Changes the Color and Size Configuration for the datatable to the one precised by the user.
00441         """
00442         if (getBiotype(method, processing) in CONTINOUS_BIOTYPES):
00443             ## Color configuration
00444             dname = self.getDataName((method, processing))
00445             print("Configuring display for " + dname)
00446             step_count = self.display_config.step_count
00447             for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00448                 self.nv.datatableConfigSetStepCount('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, step_count-1) # NaviCell has one default step
00449 
00450             dtable = self.data[processing][method].data
00451             maxval = np.nanmax(dtable)
00452             minval = np.nanmin(dtable)
00453             # Use the same scales for positive and negative values, choose the smallest to enhance contrast
00454             if (minval * maxval < 0):
00455                 if (-minval > maxval):
00456                     minval = -maxval
00457                 elif (maxval > -minval):
00458                     maxval = -minval
00459             ftable = dtable.flatten()
00460             ftable.sort()
00461 
00462             if (len(ftable[np.isnan(ftable)]) > 0):
00463                 navicell_offset = 1 # First value is nan
00464                 for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00465                     self.nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, 0, self.display_config.na_color)
00466             else:
00467                 navicell_offset = 0
00468 
00469             if (self.display_config.zero_color != ""):
00470                 half_count = step_count//2
00471                 if (half_count != 1):
00472                     # Negative values
00473                     if (minval > 0): maxval = -1
00474                     step = -minval/half_count
00475                     values_list = [signif(val) for val in np.arange(minval, step/2, step)][:-1]
00476                     for ii in range(half_count):
00477                        value = values_list[ii]
00478                        color = self.display_config.colors[ii]
00479                        for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00480                            self.nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, value)
00481                            self.nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, color)
00482                     # Zero if present
00483                     offset = half_count
00484                     if (step_count%2 == 1):
00485                         for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00486                             self.nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, offset + navicell_offset, 0)
00487                             self.nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, offset + navicell_offset, self.display_config.colors[half_count])
00488                         offset += 1
00489                     # Positive values
00490                     if (maxval < 0): maxval = 1
00491                     step = maxval/half_count
00492                     values_list = [signif(val) for val in np.arange(0., maxval+step/2, step)][1:]
00493                     for ii in range(half_count):
00494                         value = values_list[ii]
00495                         color = self.display_config.colors[offset + ii]
00496                         for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00497                             self.nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + offset + ii, value)
00498                             self.nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + offset + ii, color)
00499                 else:
00500                     if (step_count == 2):
00501                         values_list = [minval, maxval]
00502                     else:
00503                         values_list = [minval, 0, maxval]
00504                     for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00505                         for ii in range(len(values_list)):
00506                             self.nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, values_list[ii])
00507                             self.nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, self.display_config.colors[ii])
00508             else:
00509                 for ii in range(step_count):
00510                     value = np.percentile(dtable, ii*100/(step_count-1))
00511                     if (ii==0): value = minval
00512                     elif (ii==(step_count-1)): value = maxval
00513                     color = self.display_config.colors[ii]
00514                     for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00515                         self.nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, value)
00516                         self.nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, color)
00517 
00518             self.nv.datatableConfigSetSampleMethod('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, NaviCell.METHOD_CONTINUOUS_MEDIAN) # TODO change to MEAN when group mean is corrected to <= instead of <
00519             if self.display_config.use_absolute_values:
00520                 self.nv.datatableConfigSetSampleAbsoluteValue("", dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, True)
00521             else:
00522                 self.nv.datatableConfigSetSampleAbsoluteValue("", dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, False)
00523 
00524             ## Size configuration TODO add zero if present
00525             for glyph_id in range(1, MAX_GLYPHS):
00526                 for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00527                     self.nv.datatableConfigSetSizeAt("", dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_SIZE, tab, 0, self.display_config.na_size)
00528 
00529             self.nv.datatableConfigApply('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR)
00530         
00531     # Display data
00532     def display(self, perform_list, default_samples="all: 1.0", colors="", module='', reset=True):
00533         """
00534         Display data on the NaviCell map
00535         Args :
00536             perform_list (list of 2-tuples): each tuple must contain the name of the data to display and the mode of display ("glyphN_(color|size|shape)", "barplot", "heatmap" or "map_staining"). Barplots and heatmaps cannot be displayed simultaneously. Several data types can be specified for heatmaps. Specifying "glyph" (without number) will automatically select a new glyph for each data using the same properties (shape, color or size) in glyphs (maximum of 5 glyphs).
00537             colors : range of colors to use (NOT IMPLEMENTED YET)
00538             default_samples (str or list of str) : Samples to use. Only the first sample is used for glyphs and map staining, all default_samples from the list are used for heatmaps and barplots. Use 'all_samples' to use all default_samples or ['annot1:...:annotn', 'all_groups'] to use all groups corresponding to the combinations of annot1...annotn.
00539         """
00540         # Correct if the user give a single tuple
00541         if (isinstance(perform_list, tuple)):
00542             perform_list = [perform_list]
00543         assert isinstance(perform_list, list), "perform list must be a list"
00544         assert isinstance(perform_list[0], tuple) and (len(perform_list[0]) == 2 or len(perform_list[0]) == 3), "perform list must be a list of (2/3)-tuples"
00545         self.checkBrowser()
00546         self.exportAnnotations()
00547         if (reset):
00548             self.resetDisplay()
00549 
00550         # Preprocess the perform list to get valid data_name, and export data that have not been exported yet
00551         if (DEBUG_NAVICOM):
00552             print(perform_list)
00553         for perf_id in range(len(perform_list)):
00554             data_name = perform_list[perf_id][0]
00555             perform = perform_list[perf_id]
00556             if (isinstance(data_name, str)):
00557                 if (not data_name in self.associated_data):
00558                     data_name = data_name + "_raw"
00559                 data_name = self.associated_data[data_name]
00560             processing = data_name[0]
00561             method = data_name[1]
00562             assert processing in self.processings, "Processing " + processing + " does not exist"
00563             self.exportData(method, processing)
00564             if (len(perform) >= 3 and perform[2] != default_samples):
00565                 perform_list[perf_id] = (self.data_names[processing][method], perform[1], perform[2])
00566             else:
00567                 perform_list[perf_id] = (self.data_names[processing][method], perform[1], '')
00568         self.exportData("uniform")
00569 
00570         # Control that the user does not try to display to many data or use several times the same display
00571         if (True):
00572             for gtype in GLYPH_TYPES:
00573                 glyph = {gtype:[False] * MAX_GLYPHS}
00574             sample_for_glyph = [False] * MAX_GLYPHS
00575             glyph_samples = [""] * MAX_GLYPHS
00576             glyph_set = False
00577             heatmap = False
00578             barplot = False
00579             barplot_data = ""
00580             map_staining = False
00581             default_samples = self.processSampleSelection(default_samples)
00582             samples = default_samples
00583             lastWasDefault = True
00584             valid_default = (len(default_samples) == 1 and default_samples != "all_groups" and default_samples != "all_samples")
00585         # Perform the display depending of the selected mode
00586         for perform in perform_list:
00587             all_samples = False
00588             all_groups = False
00589             data_name = perform[0]
00590             dmode = perform[1]
00591             dmode = dmode.lower()
00592             # Check groups in NaviCell and get a valid list of samples, reload default if not the last used
00593             if (perform[2] == ''):
00594                 if (not lastWasDefault):
00595                     samples = self.processSampleSelection(default_samples)
00596                     lastWasDefault = True
00597             else:
00598                 samples = self.processSampleSelection(perform[2])
00599                 lastWasDefault = False
00600             if (samples == "all_groups"):
00601                 all_groups = True
00602             elif (samples == "all_samples"):
00603                 all_samples = True
00604 
00605             if (re.search("^(glyph|color|size|shape)", dmode)):
00606                 glyph_set = True
00607                 # Extract the glyph id and the setup
00608                 parse_setup = dmode.split("_")
00609                 glyph_setup = parse_setup
00610                 if (len(parse_setup) == 2):
00611                     try:
00612                         glyph_setup = [parse_setup[1] + str(int(parse_setup[0][-1]))]
00613                     except ValueError:
00614                         glyph_setup = [parse_setup[1]]
00615                 elif (len(parse_setup) != 1):
00616                     raise ValueError("Glyph specification '" + dmode + "' incorrect")
00617                 try:
00618                     glyph_number = int(glyph_setup[0][-1])
00619                     glyph_type = glyph_setup[0][:-1]
00620                 except ValueError:
00621                     glyph_type = glyph_setup[0]
00622                     glyph_number = 1
00623                     while (glyph[glyph_type][glyph_number-1]):
00624                         glyph_number += 1
00625                 glyph_id = glyph_number - 1
00626                 
00627                 if (not glyph_number in range(1, MAX_GLYPHS+1)):
00628                     raise ValueError("Glyph number must be in [1," + str(MAX_GLYPHS) + "]")
00629                 if (not glyph_type in GLYPH_TYPES):
00630                     raise ValueError("Glyph type must be one of " + str(GLYPH_TYPES))
00631                 if (glyph[glyph_type][glyph_number-1]):
00632                     raise ValueError(glyph_type + " for glyph " + str(glyph_number) + " has already been specified")
00633                 glyph[glyph_type][glyph_number-1] = True
00634                 if (len(samples) != 1 or samples == "all_groups" or samples == "all_samples"):
00635                     raise ValueError("Only one group or sample can be used for glyphs")
00636 
00637                 if (lastWasDefault):
00638                     pass
00639                 elif (glyph_samples[glyph_id] == ""):
00640                     glyph_samples[glyph_id] = samples[0]
00641                     sample_for_glyph[glyph_id] = True
00642                 elif (glyph_samples[glyph_id] != samples[0]):
00643                     raise ValueError("Only one sample can be specified per glyph")
00644 
00645                 cmd="self.nv.glyphEditorSelect" + glyph_type.capitalize() + "Datatable('" + module +  "', " + str(glyph_number) + ", '" + data_name + "')"
00646                 if (DEBUG_NAVICOM):
00647                     print(cmd)
00648                 exec(cmd)
00649             elif (re.search("map_?staining", dmode)):
00650                 assert valid_default, "Only one sample can be used for map staining"
00651                 if (not map_staining):
00652                     self.nv.mapStainingEditorSelectDatatable(module, data_name)
00653                     self.nv.mapStainingEditorSelectSample(module, samples[0])
00654                     self.nv.mapStainingEditorApply(module)
00655                     map_staining = True
00656                 else:
00657                     raise ValueError("Map staining can only be applied once, use a separate call to the display function to change map staining")
00658             elif (re.search("heatmap", dmode)):
00659                 if (barplot):
00660                     raise ValueError("Heatmaps and barplots cannot be applied simultaneously, use a separate call to the display function to perform the heatmap")
00661                 heatmap = True
00662                 # Select data
00663                 self.nv.heatmapEditorSelectDatatable(module, self.hdid, data_name)
00664                 self.hdid += 1
00665                 # Select samples
00666                 if (all_samples):
00667                     self.nv.heatmapEditorAllSamples(module)
00668                 elif (all_groups):
00669                     self.nv.heatmapEditorAllGroups(module)
00670                 elif (self.hsid == 0):
00671                     for spl in samples:
00672                         self.nv.heatmapEditorSelectSample(module, self.hsid, spl)
00673                         self.hsid += 1
00674                     self.nv.heatmapEditorApply(module)
00675             elif (re.search("barplot", dmode)):
00676                 if (heatmap):
00677                     raise ValueError("Heatmaps and barplots cannot be applied simultaneously, use a separate call to the display function to perform the barplot")
00678                 # Check that it does not try to add new data, and simply adds samples # TODO Remove as samples cannot be added (resetDisplay at the beginning)
00679                 if (barplot and data_name != barplot_data and not re.search("all|groups|samples", data_name)):
00680                     raise ValueError("Barplot has already been set with different data, use a separate call to the display function to perform another barplot")
00681                 barplot = True
00682                 barplot_data = data_name
00683                 self.nv.barplotEditorSelectDatatable(module, data_name)
00684                 # Select samples
00685                 if (all_samples):
00686                     self.nv.barplotEditorAllSamples(module)
00687                 elif (all_groups):
00688                     self.nv.barplotEditorAllGroups(module)
00689                 elif (self.bid == 0):
00690                     for spl in samples:
00691                         self.nv.barplotEditorSelectSample(module, self.bid, spl)
00692                         self.bid += 1
00693                     self.nv.barplotEditorApply(module)
00694             else:
00695                 raise ValueError("'" + dmode + "' drawing mode does not exist")
00696 
00697         # Check that datatables are selected for all glyphs features (until default has been added)
00698         # or complete, then apply the glyphs configuration
00699         default_samples = self.processSampleSelection(default_samples)
00700         if (glyph_set):
00701             for glyph_id in range(MAX_GLYPHS):
00702                 nsets = sum(1 for cs in GLYPH_TYPES if glyph[cs][glyph_id])
00703                 if (nsets > 0):
00704                     if (sample_for_glyph[glyph_id]):
00705                         self.nv.glyphEditorSelectSample(module, glyph_id+1, self.processSampleSelection(glyph_samples[glyph_id]))
00706                     elif (valid_default):
00707                         print("Using default sample for glyph " + str(glyph_id+1))
00708                         self.nv.glyphEditorSelectSample(module, glyph_id+1, default_samples[0])
00709                     else:
00710                         raise ValueError("No samples specified for glyph " + str(glyph_id+1) + " and default_samples is invalid")
00711                     if (not glyph["color"][glyph_id]):
00712                         self.nv.glyphEditorSelectColorDatatable(module, glyph_id+1, "uniform")
00713                     if (not glyph["shape"][glyph_id]):
00714                        self.nv.glyphEditorSelectShapeDatatable(module, glyph_id+1, "uniform")
00715                     if (not glyph["size"][glyph_id]):
00716                         self.nv.glyphEditorSelectSizeDatatable(module, glyph_id+1, "uniform")
00717                     self.nv.glyphEditorApply(module, glyph_id+1)
00718 
00719     def resetDisplay(self):
00720         """
00721         Reset the data and samples selections in NaviCell
00722         """
00723         for ii in range(self.bid):
00724             self.nv.barplotEditorSelectSample('', ii, '')
00725         self.nv.barplotEditorSelectDatatable('', '')
00726         self.nv.drawingConfigSelectBarplot('', False)
00727 
00728         for ii in range(self.hsid):
00729             self.nv.heatmapEditorSelectSample('', ii, '')
00730         for ii in range(self.hdid):
00731             self.nv.heatmapEditorSelectDatatable('', ii, '')
00732         self.nv.drawingConfigSelectHeatmap('', False)
00733 
00734         for gid in range(1, MAX_GLYPHS):
00735             for gt in GLYPH_TYPES:
00736                 exec("self.nv.glyphEditorSelect" + gt.capitalize() + "Datatable('', " + str(gid) + ", '')")
00737             self.nv.glyphEditorSelectSample('', gid, '')
00738             self.nv.drawingConfigSelectGlyph('', gid, False)
00739         
00740         self.nv.drawingConfigSelectMapStaining('', False)
00741         self.nv.drawingConfigApply('')
00742 
00743         # Reset the counters
00744         self.bid = 0
00745         self.hsid = 0
00746         self.hdid = 0
00747 
00748     def resetAnnotations(self, module=''):
00749         for annot in self.annotations.annotations:
00750             self.nv.sampleAnnotationSelectAnnotation(module, annot, False)
00751         self.nv.sampleAnnotationApply(module)
00752 
00753     def selectAnnotations(self, annotations, module=''):
00754         if (isinstance(annotations, str)):
00755             self.nv.sampleAnnotationSelectAnnotation(module, annotations, True)
00756         elif (isinstance(annotations, list)):
00757             for annot in annotations:
00758                 self.nv.sampleAnnotationSelectAnnotation(module, annot, True)
00759         else:
00760             raise ValueError("'annotations' must be a string or a list")
00761         self.nv.sampleAnnotationApply(module)
00762 
00763     def processSampleSelection(self, current_samples):
00764         """
00765         Process a list of samples or groups to a list of samples/groups names exportable to NaviCell or to "all_groups"/"all_samples" for heatmap and barplot, and select the correct groups in NaviCell
00766         """
00767 
00768         self.resetAnnotations()
00769         # Make sure current_samples is a list
00770         all_groups = False
00771         if (isinstance(current_samples, str)):
00772             current_samples = [current_samples]
00773 
00774         # It is possible to select all samples or all groups on heatmap and barplot
00775         if (current_samples[0] == "all_samples" or current_samples[0] == "samples"):
00776             return "all_samples"
00777         elif (current_samples[0] == "all" or current_samples[0] == "all: 1.0"):
00778             self.selectAnnotations("all")
00779             return ["all: 1.0"]
00780         elif (len(current_samples) > 1 and (current_samples[1] == "all_groups" or current_samples[1] == "groups")):
00781             all_groups = True
00782 
00783         refGroupsList = []
00784         first_groups = True
00785         # Select the groups that must be selected to produce the composite groups required
00786         for sample in current_samples:
00787             groups = self.processGroupsName(sample)[0]
00788             # Check that all groups are compatible in the annotations selected (because lower order composition are not generated). No check for individual samples
00789             if (len(groups) >= 1):
00790                 if (first_groups): # Select the set of annotations for the first group
00791                     if (DEBUG_NAVICOM):
00792                         print("Selecting " + str(groups))
00793                     for group in groups:
00794                         self.selectAnnotations(group) 
00795                         refGroupsList.append(group)
00796                         first_groups = False
00797                 else: # Control that all other groups are compatible
00798                         assert len(group)==0 or len(refGroupsList)==0 or len(group)==len(refGroupsList), "Groups combinations are not compatible, different number of groups"
00799                         for group in groups:
00800                             assert group in refGroupsList, "Groups combinations are not compatibles as " + group + " is not in " + str(refGroupsList)
00801 
00802         if (all_groups):
00803             return "all_groups"
00804         return current_samples
00805 
00806     def processGroupsName(self, groupName):
00807         """
00808         Process a group selection string and return the names of the individual groups to select and the corresponding values selected.
00809         """
00810         selections = groupName.split(";")
00811         groups = list()
00812         values = list()
00813         for select in selections:
00814             subName = select.split(":")
00815             group = subName[0].strip()
00816             if (group in self.annotations.annotations):
00817                 value = subName[1].strip()
00818                 groups.append(group)
00819                 try:
00820                     values.append(float(value))
00821                 except ValueError:
00822                     values.append(value)
00823             elif (not (group in self.annotations.samples or re.match("sub", group) or group == "NaN")):
00824                 if (len(subName) > 1):
00825                     raise ValueError("Annotation " + group + " does not exist")
00826                 else:
00827                     raise ValueError("Sample " + group + " does not exist")
00828         return((groups, values))
00829 
00830     def displayMethylome(self, samples="all: 1.0", processing="raw", background="mRNA", methylation="glyph"):
00831         """
00832             Display the methylation data as glyphs or heatmap on the NaviCell map, with mRNA expression of gene CNV as map staining
00833             Args:
00834                 background (str) : should genes, mRNA or no data be used for the map staining
00835                 processing (str) : should the processed data be used
00836         """
00837         # Groups cannot be used for now because of limitations in NaviCell unless the median is taken as grouping operation
00838         mrna_alias = ["MRNA"] # TODO Define what to put here
00839         gene_alias = ["CNV", "CNA", "CCNA", "CCNV", "DNA"]
00840         background = background.upper()
00841         assert background in mrna_alias + gene_alias + ["NO", ""], "Select either genes, mRNA or no data for the map staining"
00842         assert methylation in ["glyph", "glyphs", "heatmap", "size", "glyph_size"], "Cannot use " + methylation + " to display methylation data"
00843         if (methylation != "heatmap"): methylation="size"
00844         assert processing in self.data, "Processing " + processing + " does not exist"
00845 
00846         # Select all methylation data and display as heatmap
00847         disp_selection = list()
00848         for method in self.data[processing]:
00849             included = method.lower() in METHODS_TYPE
00850             if (re.search("methylation", method.lower()) or (included and METHODS_TYPE[method.lower()] == "methylation")):
00851                 disp_selection.append((self.data_names[processing][method], methylation)) # TODO Change to barplot when several datatables can be used
00852         # Display mRNA or gene data as map staining
00853         if (background in mrna_alias):
00854             for mrna in TYPES_SPEC["mRNA"][0]:
00855                 if (mrna in self.data[processing]):
00856                     disp_selection.append((self.data_names[processing][mrna], "map_staining"))
00857                     break
00858         elif (background in gene_alias):
00859             for gene in TYPES_SPEC["cCNA"]+TYPES_SPEC["dCNA"]:
00860                 if (gene in self.data[processing]):
00861                     disp_selection.append((self.data_names[processing][mrna], "map_staining"))
00862                     break
00863         if (DEBUG_NAVICOM):
00864             print(disp_selection)
00865             print(samples)
00866         self.display(disp_selection, samples)
00867 
00868     def displayTranscriptome(self, dataName, group="all: 1.0", samplesDisplay="", samples=list(), binsNb=10):
00869         """
00870         Display one transcriptome data as map staining, with optionnaly some extra displays (samples as heatmap or barplot, mutations as glyphs, a glyph for the most highly expressed genes)
00871         Args:
00872             - dataName (str or tuple): name or identifier of the data.
00873             - group (str): Identifier of the group to display
00874             - samplesDisplay (str): Channel where the individual samples should be displayed (heatmap or barplot)
00875             - samples (list or str): list of samples to display, or a string specifying how such a list should be built ('quantiles' to get the distribution of values)
00876             - nbOfSamples (int): number of individual samples to display, ignored if samples is a list
00877         """
00878         allowedDisplays = ["", "heatmap", "barplot"]
00879         assert samplesDisplay in allowedDisplays, "samplesDisplay must one of " + str(allowedDisplays)
00880         dataName = self.getDataName(dataName)
00881         self.display([(dataName, "map_staining")], group)
00882         if (samplesDisplay != ""):
00883             if (isinstance(samples, list)):
00884                 self.display([(dataName, samplesDisplay)], samples, reset=False)
00885             elif (isinstance(samples, str)):
00886                 if (samples == "quantiles"):
00887                     distName, distSamples = self.generateDistributionData(dataName, group, binsNb)
00888                     self.data["distribution"][distName].exportToNaviCell(self.nv, TYPES_BIOTYPE['mRNA'], distName)
00889                     self.display([(distName, samplesDisplay)], distSamples, reset=False)
00890                 else:
00891                     self.display([(dataName, samplesDisplay)], [samples], reset=False)
00892 
00893     def generateDistributionData(self, dataName, group, binsNb=10):
00894         """
00895         Compute distribution of values for all genes for one type of data. Use the same scale for all genes. The distribution is centered on 0 if it is included, so that it is easy to see if a gene is over- or under-expressed.
00896         """
00897         groups, values = self.processGroupsName(group)
00898         if (len(groups) < 1):
00899             raise ValueError("Cannot generate a distribution without a valid group")
00900         # Each distribution 
00901         distName = "distribution_" + dataName + "_" + re.sub(" ", "_", group) + "_" + str(binsNb)
00902         distSamples = ["sub" + str(ii) for ii in range(binsNb)] + ["NaN"]
00903         if (distName in self.data["distribution"]):
00904             return(distName)
00905 
00906         # Identify the samples selected by the group definition
00907         samples = self.annotations.samplesPerCategory[groups[0]][values[0]]
00908         for idx in range(1, len(groups)):
00909             to_drop = list()
00910             for spl in samples:
00911                 if (not spl in self.annotations.samplesPerCategory[groups[idx]][values[idx]]):
00912                     to_drop.append(spl)
00913             for spl in to_drop:
00914                 samples.remove(spl)
00915 
00916         # Build the distribution dataset
00917         data = self.getData(dataName)[samples]
00918         minq = np.nanmin(data.data)
00919         maxq = np.nanmax(data.data)
00920         step = (maxq-minq)/binsNb
00921         if (minq * maxq < 0):
00922             step = max(-minq/(binsNb/2), maxq/(binsNb/2))
00923         qseq = np.arange(minq, maxq + step * 1.01, step)
00924         newData = list()
00925         for gene in data.genes:
00926             newData.append([0 for ii in range(binsNb+1)])
00927             for value in data[gene]:
00928                 if (np.isnan(value)):
00929                     newData[-1][binsNb] += 1
00930                 else:
00931                     idx = 0
00932                     while (value > qseq[idx+1]):
00933                         idx += 1
00934                     newData[-1][idx] += 1
00935         self.data["distribution"][distName] = NaviData(newData, data.genes, distSamples)
00936         # Fill the dictionnaries to avoid display bugs
00937         self.data_names['distribution'][distName] = distName
00938         self.associated_data[distName] = ('distribution', distName)
00939 
00940         return(distName, distSamples)
00941 
00942     def colorsOverlay(self, red="uniform", green="uniform", blue="uniform", processing=""):
00943         """
00944         Create a dataset where values are colors. The color is calculated according to three datasets.
00945 
00946         Args:
00947             red : data name or tuple (processing, method)
00948             green : data name or tuple (processing, method)
00949             blue : data name or tuple (processing, method)
00950         """
00951         assert red != "uniform" or green != "uniform" or blue != "uniform", "You must choose a datatable"
00952         # TODO export to NaviCell and display
00953         colors = [red, green, blue]
00954         mset = ""
00955         # Empty string table
00956         dims = self.data["uniform"].data.shape
00957         dataset = np.zeros(dims, '<U7')
00958         for rr in range(dims[0]):
00959             for cc in range(dims[1]):
00960                 dataset[rr,cc] = "#"
00961         for col in colors:
00962             if (col == "uniform"):
00963                 for rr in range(dims[0]):
00964                     for cc in range(dims[1]):
00965                         dataset[rr,cc] += "00" # Default to black
00966             else:
00967                 # Pick the datatable
00968                 if (processing == ""):
00969                     processing, method = getDataTuple(col)
00970                 elif (not processing in self.data):
00971                     raise ValueError("Processing " + processing + " does not exist")
00972                 elif (not col in self.data[processing]):
00973                     raise ValueError("Method \"" + col + "\" does not exist with processing \"" + processing + "\"")
00974                 else:
00975                     method = col
00976                 if (processing != "raw"):
00977                     mset += processing + "_"
00978                 mset += method + "_"
00979                 # Input the value in the new dataset
00980                 minval = np.nanmin(self.data[processing][method].data)
00981                 maxval = np.nanmax(self.data[processing][method].data)
00982                 if (np.isnan(minval) or np.isnan(maxval)):
00983                     warn("Datatable (" + processing + ", " + method + ") does not contain any value.")
00984                     for rr in range(dims[0]):
00985                         for cc in range(dims[1]):
00986                             dataset[rr,cc] = "00"
00987                 else:
00988                     for rr in range(dims[0]):
00989                         for cc in range(dims[1]):
00990                             value = self.data[processing][method].data[rr,cc]
00991                             if (np.isnan(value)):
00992                                 value = minval
00993                             intensity = re.sub("0x", "", hex(int( 16 * (value - minval) / (maxval-minval) )) )
00994                             if (len(intensity) == 0):
00995                                 intensity = "0" + intensity
00996                             dataset[rr,cc] += intensity
00997         mset = re.sub("_$", "", mset)
00998         self.data["colors"][mset] = NaviData(dataset, self.data[processing][method].rows, self.data[processing][method].columns, processing="colors", method="unknown")
00999 
01000     # Saving data
01001     def saveAllData(self, folder=""):
01002         """
01003         Save all data in an .ncc file. Does not save the distribution nor color data.
01004         """
01005         if (folder != ""):
01006             folder = re.sub("/?$", "/", folder)
01007         fname = folder + self.name + ".ncc"
01008         print("Saving as " + fname)
01009         ff = open(fname, "w")
01010         ff.close()
01011         allProcessings = list(self.data)
01012         allProcessings.remove("uniform")
01013         allProcessings.remove("distribution")
01014         allProcessings.remove("color")
01015         for processing in allProcessings:
01016             for method in self.data[processing]:
01017                 print("Saving " + processing + ", " + method)# + ", " + str(self.data[processing][method]))
01018                 self.data[processing][method].saveData(fname, "a")
01019         print("Saving Annotations")
01020         self.annotations.saveData(fname, "a")
01021 
01022     def saveData(self, method, processing="raw", folder="./"):
01023         """
01024         Save the data in a file that can be exported to NaviCell or imported in NaviCom
01025         """
01026         # TODO authorize to provide a list to save a custom dataset
01027         if (folder != ""):
01028             folder = re.sub("/?$", "/", folder)
01029         if (processing in self.data):
01030             if (method in self.data[processing]):
01031                 self.data[processing][method].saveData(baseName=folder+self.name)
01032             else:
01033                 raise ValueError("Method " + method + " does not exist with processing " + processing)
01034         else:
01035             raise ValueError("Processing " + processing + " does not exist")
